page.title: 10LEATON KNOLLS CONT'D.
page.content: {LEATON KNOLLS }_ NATURAL HISTORY & ECOLOGY(CONT. FROM PAGE 9) The woodlands in this area form an ideal home for the chiffchaff,woodpeckers and some of the tit family.Some owls may be present around farms & woodlands.In the fields,long _ tailed tits,swallows,starlings finches & wagtails live.Some birds of prey may also glide overhead,along with crows,magpies,& pigeons.Pheasants live in the hedgerow. The conditions are suitable in this area for foxes,badgers & some of the stoat weasel family.The mole is abundant in pasturelands,along with hedgehogs & rabbits.Many species of mice,shrew & vole live in hedges & fields.Hares live in lowland grassland.Some grey & red squirrels live in the woodlands.
